message: Would love to hear peoples thoughts and suggestions about StartupLi.st!
make it sementic
interesting site.
looks like they display / link to newly submitted startups.
nice UI/design
like a css gallery - but for startups.
I spent 2-3 minutes on the landing page trying to figure out what the site was... looking for an about page or something...
I have it sitting in my RSS reader but I rarely click through to it (unless it sounds interesting). I guess that means my "perceived value" is fairly low.
your facebook button on the left is 1px lower then the twitter button
love the look of it, pretty sharp!
yeah. but i like killerstartups for the subtitles and the little pages
Like killerstartups.com...only I like the look/layout better.
Nick!  I just applied for startup list.  I forgot you started it, looked completely different when I checked it out last. Haha now I feel dumb.  Looks great, love the culture
...or maybe there was a different startup featured with the feedback thing extended... any way, good stuff :)
Thanks a lot for the feedback! I'll fix the pixel, add the about me page, and more features are in the works.
@bradendouglass What would raise the perceived value for you?

@JeffBajayo Personally I like your UI more than that of killerstartups. Like Graham said the fb icon is 1px lower than the twitter. If you go over the site with a fine tooth comb I'm sure you can find a lot of small UI tweaks.
@sameerg Please explain :)
@nickfrost Under interviews it would be nice to be able to tweet specific interviews instead of just tweeting to the interview page.
@garrettholborn In the lower right corner of every post box, there is a "share" button. Click to share short URL, Like on Facebook, and Tweet. I can make that more prominent though, thanks!

@garrettholborn Thanks! (I'm StartupList's founder) I'll look over the site for tweaks. This isn't the look we're aiming for, but it's in process of being upgraded. Are there any features you'd like to see?
@nickfrost I'm thinking that a twitter and facebook logo would increase the rate or sharing as they are widely recognized and most users instantly understand what action is being made.

@garrettholborn Right, makes sense. In the future, the interviews section will be moved to WP like the main site. My current lack of a dev is making that a bit difficult though. Thanks for the suggestion!

@nickfrost Video will mean travel, a lot of start ups are SV and I'm assuming your SV so that simplifies it. You can always do webcam interviews for non-SV startups. I have to agree, I enjoy actually seeing founders as opposed to just reading interviews.
thats what im talkin about

@myke  I agree. Video may be in a month or so, as I don't have a camera, but we are starting podcast reviews of the startups we feature. This too will be video in the future. Perhaps something more interactive with our readers as well. You being a founder, would you want to chat with StartupList readers?
@garrettholborn True! I'll have access to many startups in SV and LA area. There are some already lined up for March, and they'll only increase as StartupList grows. Thanks a lot for the feedback!

@myke Yep, still the same StartupList, we just converted from Tumblr to Wordpress for more diversity. Obviously more things to add, and an exciting partnership with another beta startup in March. Would you say that video, audio, or text interviews of the founders are best?

Video is ideal.  I think people are more likely to watch then read.  Sometimes text could invoke a better more thought out interview.  I'm not into audio, but some podcasters might disagree.  (audio versions of video available in podcast?)
. o o
Most definitely.  I love talking about what i do
I just signed up for killerstartups.com and after signup was brought to a page which sayd I can pay $99 to move to the front of the queue essentially..  could be a good idea
for SL
@myke Would be good for revenue of course, but there's this OTHER (secret) feature in progress that could possibly use that revenue model.
@nickfrost if i m reading a post i want to see related posts linked on the same page
@sameerg Good point! That shouldn't be hard to implement.
@nickfrost u can use zemanta
cool
@garytripp Thanks a lot! :)
@sameerg I know I can use that while creating the posts, but do you have any suggestions for an automatic related posts WP plugin? Thoughts on "Yet Another Related Posts Plugin"
@nickfrost sounds good by claims n testimonials hvnt tried it yet
Thanks a lot for all your feedback everyone! me and @nickfrost truly appreciate it and will try and implement all of your comments :-)
nice UI
Just a little confused about what this site actually does
I love the look and just added it to my RSS
@xjconlyme Thx man :D
Just visited the site. It looks very sleek and professional
reader
@mbetten10 just submit your startup on our site, or you can go over to convore.com/startuplist and submit it in the topic there
@Wing_Criticrania We feature startups in beta, alpha and new ones etc... :-) Were also starting a podcast and some other stuff
@jesse_dhillon awesome! thanks so much for your support!
@JeffBajayo how can a startup get recognized by StartupLi.st?
@JeffBajayo Awesome. Thank you!
